name: Pawlynesian Triangles
description:
Description

Pawlynesian Triangles is a project developed for the MicroStudio Game Jam #3 by the students and their teacher of the Lycée Paul Gauguin high school from French Polynesia. 

Game rules

This game is inspired by the "Pipopipette" or "Dots and Boxes" but with triangles. Each turn, players need to close triangles by selecting two coconuts trees.  The winner is the one who has closed the most triangles.  Closing a triangle give the player a replay. 

Game features
  • Player vs AI  : AI can't play with powers ;
  • Player vs Player  : can both play with powers ;
  • Map size : 9 triangles, 36 triangles or 81 triangles ;
  • Power up : 
    • Counter : Player can delete an opponent line ;
    • Pass : Player can pass his turn ;
    • Control : Player can control an opponent triangle but skip his turn.
Game design
  • The island, the dogs and the coconut were hand drawn by Léa ZUCCHI-JOURDAN.
  • Buttons were generated with : https://loading.io
Sound and music
  • Game music is Clear Day by Benjamin Tissot downloaded on https://www.bensound.com
  • Game sound were downloaded on https://www.freesfx.co.uk
